details: “X” is the twenty-fourth letter of the modern English alphabet. It represents the /ks/ sound, as in 'box'. The letter 'X' is often used in words related to crossing, marking, and multiplication.

wordsData.definition: a musical instrument with wooden bars struck by mallets to produce sound
wordsData.example: She played a beautiful tune on the xylophone.

wordsData.definition: a container with flat sides and a lid, typically used for storing things
wordsData.example: The box was filled with books.

wordsData.definition: a form of electromagnetic radiation used for imaging the inside of objects
wordsData.example: The doctor took an X-ray to check for fractures.

wordsData.definition: a chemical element, a colorless, dense gas used in some types of lamps
wordsData.example: Xenon lights are bright and energy-efficient.

rhymes.name: X is for Xylophone (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star')
content: X is for xylophone, play the tune,
With wooden bars that make a swoon.
Struck by mallets, sound so clear,
X is for xylophone, music we hear.

rhymes.name: X is for X-ray (to the tune of 'If You’re Happy and You Know It')
content: X is for X-ray, shining bright,
Looking inside with all its might.
It shows us bones and hidden things,
X is for X-ray, what it brings!
